Key Match Events: The New Orleans Pelicans swept the season series with the Washington Wizards after a 110-98 victory.
Pelicans guard CJ McCollum led the team with 25 points.
All five Pelicans starters scored in double-figures.
The Pelicans made 18 three-pointers in consecutive games for the first time all season.
Pelicans forward Trey Murphy III turned his ankle and was ruled out of the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Pelicans coach Willie Green commented on the team's improved defense and strong start.
Coach Green mentioned the team's defensive efforts leading to transition opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was just the Pelicans' second road win of the season.
Washington played without its leading scorer, Jordan Poole.
